Mike,
 
The way your explaining this procedure it sounds more like traditi=
onal evp recordings
and not real time communication. are you hearing anythi=
ng real time?
 
Bruce

Bruce Halliday Paranormal Investigating Team 


To: =
EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: michaelcoletta@...: Sun, 9 Dec 2007 =
23:28:33 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Mike's Box 12.470 Proto 1




Actually=
... the output from the amplified microphone is plugged into the mic input =
of the recorder and also Y-ed to a set of earphones. The 12-470 sweeping ra=
w audio comes out of the 12-470 speaker as does the white noise come out of=
 the speaker from that device. Both units sound are fed into the chamber wh=
ere they mix with any ambient noise, then the amp mic picks it up, feeds it=
 to the recorder which records it. I could have just used the built-in mic =
on the recorder but the amp mic adds a little better tone, also you could h=
ave the recorder outside the case if you want, which would be a more ideal =
thing if you use a larger recorder or a tape recorder. That way the motor n=
oise would not mix inside the chamber.- Mike--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com,=
 "LC Duplatt" <lcdupla@...> wrote:>> Wow, that's impressive, Mike, as conce=
rning the functionality, ease > of use, etc. > > So if I understand correct=
ly, you asked a question (which was picked > up by the Olympus voice record=
er's built-in microphone), the 12-470 > was plugged directly into the Olymp=
us voice recorder to record the AM > or FM sweep for about 10 seconds after=
 the question, correct?> > Sounds like what I have been playing with.> > LC=
 Duplatt> http://www.AngelsGhosts.com> > > > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.c=
om, "M.A. Coletta (Mike)" > <michaelcoletta@> wrote:> >> > Hi LC,> > > > No=
, those files I posted here in the files area are from just the > 12-> > 47=
0 as it did a linear sweep of the AM or FM band, with no chamber > or > > w=
hite noise or amp mic. I was walking in our local cemetery hold > the > > m=
odified 12-470 near the gravesite of those I questioned. I have > not > > p=
osted any audio from the Mike's Box 12-470 system or the Spiricomp > > 12-4=
69 system yet. I plan to do one of my internet radio shows > where > > I wi=
ll debut some of the audio files from those systems.> > You can listen at h=
ttp://www.ghosttoghostpm.com on the dates those > > will broadcast. I have =
a 2 hour show on Tuesday's and Friday's. > Each > > show gets between 400 a=
nd 1200 listeners, mostly from archive > > downloads after the LIVE show is=
 over. Next Friday will be the > first > > show where I debut the newer aud=
io files.> > > > - Mike> > > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "LC Duplatt"=
 <lcdupla@> wrote:> > >> > > Mike, I have one more question for clarificati=
on. > > > > > > I listened to the various voice recordings you captured and=
 do I > > > understand correctly that the little portable-enclosed system >=
 > > (pictured on your blog) captured the audio we've heard from you > to >=
 > > date?> > > > > > Thanks.> > > > > > LC Duplatt> > > http://www.AngelsG=
hosts.com> > > > > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "M.A. Coletta (Mike)" =
> > > <michaelcoletta@> wrote:> > > >> > > > Hi LC,> > > > > > > > The two =
setups I did were:> > > > > > > > 1) Three 12-469's through a mixer, mixed =
with white noise > > > (performed > > > > with Audacity), my voice via a mi=
crophone, and all that audio > > > > captured using a free program called "=
Scanner Recorder". You > can > > > > download it here: http://www.davee.com=
/scanrec/> > > > I have not really taken that unit anywhere to test it > pr=
operly. > > I > > > > only did the original testing you hear on the video.>=
 > > > > > > > 2) One 12-470 placed in a "chamber", with a noise generator =
> (used > > > > a "My Lil' Reminder" 20 second digital recorder/player) wit=
h > > > recorded > > > > white/pink noise I captured while in Florida. Also=
 inside is > > > > a "Listen Up" amplified microphone and an Olympus digita=
l > > recorder.> > > > The only wiring is a Y-connector which connects the =
output from > > the > > > > amplified mic to the input of the recorder, and=
 also to ear-> buds > > > for > > > > listening to what is being recorded. =
You can also plug a small > > > > speaker into this if desired.> > > > The =
raw audio from the linear sweep of either the AM or FM band > > is > > > > =
projected from the 12-470 speaker, into the closed "chamber", > > along > >=
 > > with the audio from the speaker of the noise generator ("My > Lil' > >=
 > > Reminder") unit. Those two sources, plus any ambient noise > > inside =
> > > > the "chamber" is picked up by the amplified mic and fed into > the =
> > > > recorder and ear-buds. The recorder produces the .wav file.> > > > =
You can use a 12-469 instead of the 12-470. You just need to > > > connect =
> > > > a small speker to the output of the 12-469.> > > > > > > > As with =
my three 12-469 system, I have so far only done the > > initial > > > > tes=
t run on th 12-470 system. I hope to bring both units to a > > > place > > =
> > where I can do some better experimentation. I have 2 weeks off > > > ne=
ar > > > > Christmas time, so that is probably when I'll be doing that.> > =
> > > > > > I hope I have answered your questions, LC.> > > > > > > > - Mik=
e> > > > > > > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "LC Duplatt" <lcdupla@> wr=
ote:> > > > >> > > > > Mike,> > > > > > > > > > Today I modified my Radio S=
hack 12-469, but have some > > questions. > > > > It > > > > > was easy to =
do, and I instantly plugged it into my Olympus > > voice > > > > > recorder=
 and recorded off of it easily. Now I want to pipe > > some > > > > > white=
 noise in (and ambient), as well. > > > > > > > > > > 1) Is the set-up in y=
our video what has worked best for you > > (with > > > > the > > > > > comp=
uter and all)?> > > > > 2) Will you tell us what free computer programs you=
 used (I > > think > > > > one > > > > > is Audacity)?> > > > > 3) What mic=
rophone and white noise generator did you use for > > your > > > > > travel=
 pack unit pictured on UFOGeek.com (posted on December > > > 8th)? > > > > =
> And can you give me a layout for the wiring of it - you know, > > how > >=
 > > it > > > > > all hooks together? I'll figure it out sooner or later, b=
ut > > I'd > > > > > rather it be sooner!> > > > > > > > > > Thanks, LC> > =
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > --- In EVP-ITC@...=
m, "M.A. Coletta (Mike)" > > > > > <michaelcoletta@> wrote:> > > > > >> > >=
 > > > I am currently putting together another video, just like my > > > > =
others > > > > > > showing a very practical way to use the Radio Shack Hack=
 > > > devices.> > > > > > You probably saw my 12-469 practical use videos,=
 now I'm > > going > > > to > > > > > be > > > > > > sharing a 12-470 pract=
ical use video. This one is of a > > totally > > > > > > portable system th=
at uses a noise generator, the hacked 12-> > 470, > > > a > > > > > > digit=
al (or analog) recorder, and a microphone which > gathers > > > the > > > >=
 > raw > > > > > > audio sweep, white noise (or in my case a special > whit=
e/pink > > > > noise > > > > > file > > > > > > I created), and any ambient=
 noise within a chamber.. and > > places > > > > > that > > > > > > session=
 int a .wav file. It also includes an ear piece so > > you > > > > can > > =
> > > > hear, real time, what the digital recorder is recording > (the > > =
> > mixer > > > > > of > > > > > > the session sound within the chamber).> =
> > > > > Stay tuned for that video later today....> > > > > > > > > > > > =
- Mike> > > > > > All my Radio Shack Hack videos can be found at> > > > > >=
 http://www.ufogeek.com> > > > > >> > > > >> > > >> > >> >>
